title: Exploring Instructional Designers' Philosophical Beliefs: Survey-Based Science Education Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Exploring practical applicability of instructional design philosophies through project-based assessment in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the major philosophical categories of instructional design: ontology, epistemology, axiology, and methodological beliefs.
Learners can construct a decision-making process reflecting their philosophical beliefs when designing science education using surveys.
Learners can develop a feasible project design plan in a smartphone-based environment through small-group collaboration.

resources: Offline workshop kit (writing tools, activity sheets)
Science instructional design case study compendium (PDF)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
